subject: Management
title: The 10-10-10 Rule
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The 10-10-10 Rule.

hook.text: A manager was about to fire a long-time employee out of frustration after one bad quarter.

buildup.text: In the heat of the moment, short-term emotion hijacks long-term judgment.

discovery.text: Suzy Welch's 10-10-10: how will I feel about this in 10 minutes, 10 months, 10 years?

twist.text: The 10-minute answer is usually emotional. The 10-year answer reveals what really matters.

climax.text: He didn't fire. He coached. Two quarters later, the employee was his strongest performer.

punchline.text: Zoom out before you act. Time changes everything.

quiz.question: What does the 10-10-10 rule help you evaluate?
options: How a decision will feel at three different time horizons
Whether a decision can be made in under ten minutes
How many people will be affected by the decision
